Legal_Issue: Credibility of claimant's testimony and plausibility of persecution claim
Decision_Level: Administrative decision by Refugee Protection Division
Credibility_Assessment: Board found Mr. Yousuff's testimony implausible
Evidence_Type: Testimonial evidence, evidence of group behavior (SLA and LTTE)
Legal_Provision: Section 96, IRPA - Basis for refugee protection
Basis_of_Claim: Persecution by SLA and LTTE in Sri Lanka
Application_Error: Failure to account for irrational conduct of persecuting groups
Assessment_Standard: Clear and convincing reasons required for credibility findings
Evidence_Ignored: Evidence that SLA and LTTE act irrationally and target innocents
Legal_Standard: Reasons must be supported by evidence; standard of reasonableness
Decision_Review_Issue: Whether Board's reasons were supported by evidence
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Rule requiring clear and convincing reasons for disbelieving testimony
Evidentiary_Issues: Board's conclusion inconsistent with evidence on group behavior
Procedural_Fairness: Failure to provide evidence-based reasoning affects fairness
Credibility_Issues: Testimony deemed implausible without evidentiary support
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to sufficiency of Board's reasons
